casebody.data:
Kornegay Family Farms, LLC, et al.
v.
Cross Creek Seed, Inc. 187PA16-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. December 29, 2016 Andrew H. Erteschik, Attorney at Law, Steven B. Epstein, Attorney at Law, Caitlin Goforth, Attorney at Law, Saad Gul, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Cross Creek Seed, Inc. L. Neal Ellis, Jr., Attorney at Law, Wake Forest, J. P. Williamson, Jr., Attorney at Law, for Kornegay Family Farms, LLC, et al. Matthew N. Leerberg, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Kip David Nelson, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, for N.C. Association of Defense Attorneys. Jon Ward, Attorney at Law, Michael W. Patrick, Attorney at Law, Chapel Hill, for N.C. Advocates for Justice. Phillip Jacob Parker, Jr., Attorney at Law, H. Julian Philpott, Jr., Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for N.C. Farm Bureau Federation, Inc., et al.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 28th of December 2016 by NC Farm Bureau Federation, Inc., Tobacco Growers Association of NC, Inc., NC Soy Bean Producers Association, NC Peanut Growers Association, and Carolines Cotton Growers Cooperative, Inc. for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 29th of December 2016."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
